title: (x) Ben & Jerry's Font Help
content: I'm looking for a font similar to the Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream font. I realize the font was originally hand drawn by a Ben & Jerry's former Design Director (and named after her). As the company grew, she couldn't keep up with all the writing, so her hand lettering was converted to a computer format. It is a proprietary font, owned by Ben & Jerry's and is not available for sale or downloading. But does anyone have any idea as to what font would look similar
author: anonymous

comments.content: There are some great suggestions in [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015349/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/discus.pl?pg=prev&topic=83&page=3146) thread.

I am almost sure that there was another more recent thread about this Ben & Jerry's typeface and similars but can't find it.   
   
You can also take a look at the new Fountain's [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015349/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ftn_farao.asp).
There was another thread. I've tried searching too using various methods but to no avail. I wonder what happened?
thanks for the incredibly fast response!!!!

Try [Beton Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015349/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/beton/extra-bold/testdrive.html?s=BEN%26JERRY%27S&p=48) or [Stymie Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015349/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stymie/ef-black/testdrive.html?s=BEN%26JERRY%27S&p=48).   
   
They don't have the roughness, but the original handlettering was probably based on something like these.
